before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"8utfo","text":"For this protocol, perform steps 1-8 in the tube provided. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"ee82i","text":"This is the protocol for C2987H cells. If you are using the C2987I cells, please refer to this protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":90,"length":13}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"2CDF57A1C5A347E29FF5491265D0EBF4","url":"http://protocols.io/view/High-Efficiency-Transformation-Protocol-C2987I-imst35"}}}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"36fpj","text":"Transformation Protocol Variables","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":33}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2jflp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ievr","text":"Thawing: Cells are best thawed on ice and DNA added as soon as the last bit of ice in the tube disappears. Cells can also be thawed by hand, but warming above 0°C will decrease the transformation efficiency.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"iocv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5t4pq","text":"Incubation of DNA with Cells on Ice: For maximum transformation efficiency, cells and DNA should be incubated together on ice for 30 minutes. Expect a 2-fold loss in transformation efficiency for every 10 minutes this step is shortened.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":35}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2po4k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ahjcd","text":"Heat Shock: Both the temperature and the timing of the heat shock step are important and specific to the transformation volume and vessel. Using the transformation tube provided, 30 seconds at 42°C is optimal.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ahd77","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3gcvf","text":"Outgrowth: Outgrowth at 37°C for 1 hour is best for cell recovery and for expression of antibiotic resistance. Expect a 2-fold loss in transformation efficiency for every 15 minutes this step is shortened. SOC gives 2-fold higher transformation efficiency than LB medium; and incubation with shaking or rotating the tube gives 2-fold higher transformation efficiency than incubation without shaking.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"33gpa","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8q728","text":"Plating: Selection plates can be used warm or cold, wet or dry without significantly affecting the transformation efficiency. However, warm, dry plates are easier to spread and allow for the most rapid colony formation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8lodj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e11g1","text":"DNA Contaminants to Avoid","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"at6m6","text":"   Contaminant Removal Method   Detergents Ethanol precipitate   Phenol Extract with chloroform and ethanol precipitate   Ethanol or Isopropanol Dry pellet before resuspending   PEG* Column purify or phenol/chloroform extract and ethanol precipitate   DNA binding proteins (e.g. Ligase) Column purify or phenol/chloroform extract and ethanol precipitate   ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":3,"length":11},{"style":"bold","offset":15,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":356}],"data":{}},{"key":"61mg5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8itf9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"","data":{"cellsMeta":{"A_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"B_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"}},"colTitles":["",""],"colWidths":["215","414"],"data":[["\u003cstrong\u003eContaminant\u003c/strong\u003e","\u003cstrong\u003eRemoval Method\u003c/strong\u003e"],["Detergents","Ethanol precipitate"],["Phenol","Extract with chloroform and ethanol precipitate"],["Ethanol or Isopropanol","Dry pellet before resuspending"],["PEG*","Column purify or phenol/chloroform extract and ethanol precipitate"],["DNA binding proteins (e.g. Ligase)","Column purify or phenol/chloroform extract and ethanol precipitate"]],"guid":"E66BC130458111E99CE33B990B794995","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":10,"offset":333}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"66lhu","text":"* Ideally, DNA for transformation should be purified and resuspended in water or TE. However, up to 10 µl of DNA directly from a ligation mix can be used with only a two-fold loss of transformation efficiency. Where it is necessary to maximize the number of transformants (e.g. a library), a purification step, either a spin column (NEB #T1030) or phenol/chloroform extraction and ethanol precipitation should be added.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"guid":"4DB464049E9811EAA2E50A58A9FEAC2A","url":"https://www.neb.com/products/t1030-monarch-pcr-dna-cleanup-kit-5-ug"},"type":"link"}}},"mergeCells":{},"printData":[["\u003cstrong\u003eContaminant\u003c/strong\u003e","\u003cstrong\u003eRemoval Method\u003c/strong\u003e"],["Detergents","Ethanol precipitate"],["Phenol","Extract with chloroform and ethanol precipitate"],["Ethanol or Isopropanol","Dry pellet before resuspending"],["PEG*","Column purify or phenol/chloroform extract and ethanol precipitate"],["DNA binding proteins (e.g. Ligase)","Column purify or phenol/chloroform extract and ethanol precipitate"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23,23],"show_headers":true}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ce0uj","text":"Mix the cells thoroughly by flicking the tube and inverting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
